au.gov.ga.conn4d.utils

Class Spline

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.gov.ga.conn4d.utils.Spline

  • public class Spline
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Spline(int nPoints)
      Constructor initializing the Spline using a defined number of points

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calcDeriv()
      Calculates the second derivatives of the tabulated function for use by the cubic spline interpolation method.
      double[] getDeriv()
      Returns the internal array of second derivatives
      double interpolate(double xx)
      Returns an interpolated value of y for a value of x from a tabulated function y=f(x) after the data has been entered via a constructor.
      static Spline[] oneDarray(int n, int m)
      Create a one dimensional array of n (empty) Spline objects containing m elements each.
      void orderPoints()
      Sort points into an ascending abscissa order
      void resetData(double[] x, double[] y)
      Resets the x y data arrays
      static Spline zero(int n)
      Create a Spline object containing n empty (zero-value) elements

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spline

        public Spline(int nPoints)
        Constructor initializing the Spline using a defined number of points
        Parameters:
        nPoints -

    • Method Detail

      • calcDeriv

        public void calcDeriv()
        Calculates the second derivatives of the tabulated function for use by the cubic spline interpolation method. This method follows the procedure in Numerical Recipes Numerical Recipes 3rd ed. by Press et al. 2007 p.123

      • getDeriv

        public double[] getDeriv()
        Returns the internal array of second derivatives
        Returns:
        a double array containing the second derivatives

      • interpolate

        public double interpolate(double xx)
        Returns an interpolated value of y for a value of x from a tabulated function y=f(x) after the data has been entered via a constructor. The derivatives are calculated on the first call to this method and are then stored for use in subsequent calls

      • oneDarray

        public static Spline[] oneDarray(int n,
                 int m)
        Create a one dimensional array of n (empty) Spline objects containing m elements each.

      • orderPoints

        public void orderPoints()
        Sort points into an ascending abscissa order

      • resetData

        public void resetData(double[] x,
             double[] y)
        Resets the x y data arrays

      • zero

        public static Spline zero(int n)
        Create a Spline object containing n empty (zero-value) elements
        Parameters:
        n - - the number of zero-value elements in the Spline
